wjhk.jupload2.upload
Class AbstractJUploadTestHelper

java.lang.Object
  wjhk.jupload2.upload.AbstractJUploadTestHelper
Direct Known Subclasses:
ByteArrayEncoderHTTPTest, DefaultFileDataTest, DefaultJUploadContextTest, DefaultUploadPolicyTest, FileUploadManagerThreadImplTest, JUploadContextAppletTest, PacketConstructionThreadTest, PictureFileDataTest, UploadFileDataPoisonnedTest, UploadFilePacketPoisonnedTest, UploadFilePacketTest
public class AbstractJUploadTestHelper
extends Object

This class is the superclass of all test classes in this package. It creates all common objects (upload policy, queues...)

Author:
etienne_sf

testLastRegisteredUnload

public void testLastRegisteredUnload(Class expectedClass)
                              throws IllegalArgumentException,
                                     IllegalAccessException,
                                     InvocationTargetException,
                                     SecurityException,
                                     NoSuchMethodException
This method calls a given method onto a given object. It is used to execute the call of the callback registered by the last call to juploadContext.registerUnload.
This works only if juploadContext is an instance of JUploadContextTestHelper

Parameters:
expectedClass - Contains the class to which the lastRegisterUnloadObject should belong to.
Throws:
InvocationTargetException
IllegalAccessException
IllegalArgumentException
NoSuchMethodException
SecurityException

getTestFile

public static File getTestFile(String relativeFilePath)
This static class computes create a file instance for the given relative path.
This method is taken from Petr Kozelka's blog

Parameters:
relativeFilePath - The path of the file, starting from src/test/resources.
Returns:
The File for the file, whose relative path to tests folder is given in argument. This method is compatible with whatever tool is used to execute the tests: it can be from maven, from eclipse, or from any other tool.

getTestFilePath

public static String getTestFilePath(String relativeFilePath)
This method returns the absolute path for the given file. It is based on the getTestFile(String) method.

Parameters:
relativeFilePath - The path of the file, starting from src/test/resources.
Returns:
The absolute path for the given file.

getTestFilesRootPath

public static String getTestFilesRootPath()
Get the root for the tests files, whatever is the current tool used to run JUnit test: maven, eclipse, any IDE...

Returns:
The absolute path for the test files root, ending with the file separator character.
